<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_irq_get_controller:
```c
static struct metal_irq_controller *metal_irq_get_controller(int irq)
{
	struct metal_list *node;
	struct metal_irq_controller *cntr;

	metal_list_for_each(&irq_cntrs, node) {
		int irq_base, irq_end;

		cntr = (struct metal_irq_controller *)
		       metal_container_of(node, struct metal_irq_controller,
					  node);
		irq_base = cntr->irq_base;
		irq_end = irq_base + cntr->irq_num;
		if (irq >= irq_base && irq < irq_end) {
			return cntr;
		}
	}
	return NULL;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function metal_irq_get_controller:
static void _metal_irq_set_enable(int irq, unsigned int state)
{
	struct metal_irq_controller *cntr;

	cntr = metal_irq_get_controller(irq);
	if (cntr == NULL) {
		return;
	}
	cntr->irq_set_enable(cntr, irq, state);
}
...
int metal_irq_register(int irq,
		       metal_irq_handler irq_handler,
		       void *arg)
{
	struct metal_irq_controller *cntr;
	struct metal_irq *irq_data;

	cntr = metal_irq_get_controller(irq);
	if (cntr == NULL) {
		return -EINVAL;
	}
	if (cntr->irq_register != NULL) {
		return cntr->irq_register(cntr, irq, irq_handler, arg);
	}
	if (cntr->irqs == NULL) {
		return -EINVAL;
	}
	irq_data = &cntr->irqs[irq - cntr->irq_base];
	irq_data->hd = irq_handler;
	irq_data->arg = arg;
	return 0;
}
...
void metal_irq_enable(unsigned int vector)
{
	_metal_irq_set_enable((int)vector, METAL_IRQ_ENABLE);
}
...
void metal_irq_disable(unsigned int vector)
{
	_metal_irq_set_enable((int)vector, METAL_IRQ_DISABLE);
}
...
int irq
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
cntr = metal_irq_get_controller(irq);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The call cntr = metal_irq_get_controller(irq); is made from other functions (_metal_irq_set_enable, metal_irq_register, etc.). metal_irq_get_controller() implementation simply iterates a list and returns a pointer; it does not call those callers (nor itself). Therefore, in the provided code there is no direct or indirect recursion. (Note: an indirect recursion could only occur if a controller callback (e.g. cntr->irq_set_enable) were implemented to call back into _metal_irq_set_enable/metal_irq_get_controller — that is not shown here.)
